en_first_half: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

He knew that the young woman was not averse to the idea of marriage, and that she was, in fact, eager to settle down and start a family of her own. So, he set about finding a suitable suitor, a man who was wealthy and well-connected, but not too old or too disagreeable. He presented the young woman with a choice between two men, both of whom were acceptable, but one of whom was clearly more desirable than the other. The first man was a wealthy merchant, who had made his fortune in trade, but was not particularly well-educated or refined. The second man was a young nobleman, who was well-connected and well-educated, but was not as wealthy as the merchant. The stepfather knew that the young woman would be torn between the two men, and that she would ultimately choose the one who was most likely to provide for her in the manner that she desired. He also knew that the young woman's mother, who had passed away a few years ago, had always wanted her to marry well, and that she would be pleased to see her daughter settled with a man of good social standing. So, the stepfather set about manipulating the situation, using all of his cunning and experience to ensure that the young woman would choose the nobleman, and that the family's income would be preserved. But, as he was about to find out, his plans were not without their complications, and the young woman had a few tricks up her sleeve that would change the course of events in ways that he could not have anticipated.
vi_first_half: “Có một người đàn ông nọ cưới một người phụ nữ lớn tuổi hơn hắn rất nhiều chỉ vì tiền của bà ta”, anh kể, “và hắn được sử dụng tiền của cô con gái chừng nào cô vẫn còn sống chung với họ. Đó là một món hời đáng kể đối với những người trong cuộc và việc mất đi số tiền đó sẽ là một sự thay đổi rất đáng sợ. Cần phải ra sức duy trì tình trạng đó. Cô con gái không những rất tốt bụng và tử tế mà còn giàu tình cảm và hay biểu lộ ra, vì thế dễ nhận thấy là với sự nết na cộng thêm món thu nhập nho nhỏ thì cô ta sẽ không ở vậy lâu. Tất nhiên, nếu cô ta kết hôn thì họ sẽ mất đi hàng trăm bảng mỗi năm, vậy người cha dượng phải làm gì để ngăn chặn điều đó? Ông ta chọn cách dễ thấy là giữ cô ta ở trong nhà và ngăn cấm cô ta tìm
vi_second_half: kiếm bạn bè cùng lứa tuổi. Nhưng rồi ông ta nhanh chóng nhận ra đó không phải là giải pháp lâu dài. Cô ta trở nên mạnh mẽ hơn, kiên quyết bảo vệ quyền lợi của mình và cuối cùng thì nói ra miệng ý định quả quyết sẽ tham dự một buổi khiêu vũ nào đó. Người cha dượng khôn ngoan của cô ta cần phải làm gì? Ông ta nghĩ ra một kế hoạch đáng khen về trí thông minh nhưng đáng trách về mặt tình cảm. Với sự đồng lõa và hỗ trợ của người vợ, ông ta tự cải trang, che giấu đôi mắt sắc bằng cặp kính râm, hóa trang khuôn mặt bằng một bộ ria và râu quai nón rậm rạp, hạ thấp giọng nói rõ ràng thành tiếng thì thào, cộng thêm một lợi thế an toàn là cô gái bị cận thị, ông ta đã xuất hiện dưới lốt chàng trai Hosmer Angel và gạt những chàng trai khác ra xa bằng cách tỏ tình với cô gái.”

Pero, al final, la verdad saldrá a la luz, y él se verá obligado a enfrentar las consecuencias de sus acciones. La hija, que ha estado sufriendo en silencio, finalmente se decide a hablar con su padrastro, y le explica la situación de una manera clara y directa. Su padrastro se siente sorprendido y avergonzado, y se da cuenta de que ha cometido un error grave. Se disculpa con su hija y le promete que la dejará en paz, pero la herida ya está hecha, y la relación entre ellos nunca será la misma. La hija, por su parte, se siente aliviada y agradecida por la liberación, pero también se siente triste por la pérdida de la relación con su padrastro. La historia de la hija y su padrastro es un recordatorio de la importancia de la comunicación y la empatía en las relaciones familiares, y de la necesidad de ser honesto y justo en nuestras acciones hacia los demás.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

The carriage finally came to a stop, and I looked out to see that we were at a large, old-fashioned gate, which swung open with a creak as the carriage drew near. A figure emerged from the shadows, and I saw that it was a woman, dressed in a long, black cloak, her face hidden behind a veil. She beckoned to us to come forward, and Colonel Stark stepped down from the carriage, followed by me. The woman led us through the gate, and we walked along a winding path, the trees closing in around us on either side. The air was heavy with the scent of blooming flowers, and I could hear the distant sound of running water. We walked for what felt like a long time, the silence between us growing thicker and more oppressive. I began to feel a sense of disquiet, and I wondered where we were going, and what Colonel Stark's intentions were. The woman finally stopped in front of a large, old house, and pushed open the creaking door. We stepped inside, and I was immediately struck by the musty smell of old books and dust. The woman led us to a large, dimly lit room, where a fire was burning in the hearth. Colonel Stark gestured for me to sit, and I did so, feeling a sense of trepidation. The woman disappeared, and Colonel Stark sat down beside me, his eyes still fixed on mine. I felt a sense of unease, and I wondered what was to come.

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results: The light danced across her features, illuminating the delicate curve of her cheekbones and the fullness of her lips. Her eyes, a deep shade of brown that seemed almost black in the dim light, sparkled with a mixture of curiosity and wariness as she took in the sight of us standing there. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman, and I could see the faintest glimmer of a smile playing on her
en_results_raw: The light danced across her features, illuminating the delicate curve of her cheekbones and the fullness of her lips. Her eyes, a deep shade of brown that seemed almost black in the dim light, sparkled with a mixture of curiosity and wariness as she took in the sight of us standing there. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman, and I could see the faintest glimmer of a smile playing on her lips as she regarded him. She seemed to be sizing us up, trying to determine whether we were friend or foe, and I found myself holding my breath, waiting for her to make a move. The air was thick with tension, and I could feel the weight of the darkness pressing in around us, making the sudden appearance of the lamp seem all the more jarring. The woman's gaze flicked to me, and for a moment, our eyes met, a spark of connection flashing between us before she looked away, her expression unreadable. The colonel, still fumbling with the matches, finally managed to strike one, and the flame cast eerie shadows on the walls as he held it up, the light dancing across the woman's face once more. She took a step forward, her eyes never leaving his, and I could sense a undercurrent of unease running beneath the surface, a sense that something was not quite right in this strange and isolated place.

Me alegra verte aquí. ¿Qué te trae a nuestra casa esta noche?" Me sentí un poco sorprendido por su amabilidad y su belleza, y no supe qué responder. El coronel se rió y me dijo: "No te preocupes, ella es nuestra anfitriona, la señora de la casa. ¿Quieres que te presente?" La señora se rió y dijo: "No es necesario, coronel. Ya conozco al joven. ¿Quieres que te sirva algo? ¿Un té, un vaso de agua o quizá algo más fuerte?" Me sentí un poco incómodo con la situación, pero la señora parecía tan amable y acogedora que no pude negarme a su invitación. Asentí con la cabeza y ella se dirigió a la cocina para preparar algo para mí. El coronel se sentó de nuevo en su asiento y me dijo: "Espera un momento, joven. Quiero que sepas que esta casa tiene un secreto, un secreto que no se puede compartir con nadie. ¿Estás dispuesto a escuchar?" Me sentí un poco inquieto, pero asentí con la cabeza. El coronel se rió y dijo: "Bien, entonces te contaré el secreto. Pero debes prometer que no lo dirás a nadie". Me sentí un poco asustado, pero asentí con la cabeza. tr_results_raw: onlar, bana karşı son derece nazik ve misafirperver davrandılar. Ancak, evin içinde gizli bir sırrın olduğunu hissediyordum ve bu his, zamanla daha da arttı. Bir gün, Bay Rucastle, bana bir odada yalnız kaldığımı fark etti ve bana, "Bu odada ne yaptığını bilmek istiyorsan, bana sor," dedi. Bu sözleri, beni gerçekten şaşırttı ve ben de, "Ne yaptığımı bilmek istiyorsanız, bana sorun," dedim. Bay Rucastle, bana, "Bu odada, bir zamanlar bir cinayet işlendiğini biliyorsanız, bana söyleyin," dedi. Ben de, "Evet, biliyorum," dedim, çünkü o anda, bu odada bir cinayetin olduğunu hissediyordum.

en_second_half: Mr. Rucastle took me to a small outhouse which stands near the kitchen door. As we approached it I heard the sharp rattling of a chain, and the sound as of a large animal moving about.
en_results: the house seemed to be full of a bittersweet atmosphere, as if the very walls were imbued with the weight of secrets and unspoken tales. It was a place where the past and present seemed
en_results_raw: the house seemed to be full of a bittersweet atmosphere, as if the very walls were imbued with the weight of secrets and unspoken tales. It was a place where the past and present seemed to converge, where the whispers of the past lingered in every corner, and the shadows danced with an air of mystery. I recall the first time I saw the house, its turrets and spires reaching towards the sky like skeletal fingers, as if grasping for the heavens. The trees surrounding it seemed to lean in, as if they too were privy to the secrets that lay within. I felt an inexplicable sense of unease, a feeling that I was being watched, and yet, I was drawn to the place, as if it held some hidden truth that only I could uncover. Little did I know, my life was about to become inextricably linked to the enigmatic Copper Beeches, and the events that would unfold would change me forever.

es_results_raw: al jardín, donde me mostró un gran número de plantas exóticas y me explicó que había estado cultivando algunas de ellas durante años. Me pareció que estaba muy orgulloso de su jardín, pero también noté que parecía estar nervioso y alterado, como si estuviera esperando algo. Después de un rato, se disculpó y me dijo que tenía que ir a atender algo en la casa, y me dejó solo en el jardín. Mientras tanto, oí un ruido extraño proveniente de la parte trasera de la casa, y me pregunté qué podría ser. Al poco rato, el señor Rucastle regresó con una expresión seria en el rostro y me dijo que tenía que hablar conmigo sobre algo importante.

tr_results_raw: Smith'in bana gösterdiği o eski, karanlık odada, bir zamanlar bir cinayetin işlendiğini hissediyordum.
